{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Factory Admin Staff",
  "description": "PrimoFinesse - Our client,&nbsp;LoshesChocolate is a registered trademark for Firt Macaw Consult. They source and process locally grown coco beans into chocolates.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory Admin Staff

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Model: Physical (On-site)
Work Hours: Mon-Fri (8am -5pm) Sat (8am &ndash; 2pm)
Name of Company: LoshesChocolate

Key Responsibilities


	State daily on the company internal chats activities and work plans to be achieved daily.
	Ensure all activities are aligned with the policies and objectives of the organization. No decision or activity will be carried without a prior authorization on the group.
	Develop and implement admin budgets for facility supplies ensure work plan developed is aligned with Operations and set targets
	Ensure consistent and accurate data reporting in conformance with business processes &ndash; internal EXPENCE, AUDIT FILE, WHATSAPP.
	Attend to customer enquiries on WhatsApp and by phone-call.
	Take bi-monthly assessments/audits of departments and staff performance against the business goals and plans.
	Perform human resource activities including but not limited to; hiring, evaluating performance, discipline for staff, motivate through positive feedback.
	Having an in-depth knowledge of business products and value proposition.
	Developing growth strategies and business proposals to generate revenue. Attend to existing clients and source new clients to increase revenue.
	Be always polite and helpful to clients. Manage existing client relationships &ndash; B2B, B2B2C, B2C and develop strategies for client retention as well
	Manage and oversee the distribution and supply of products to clients using the approved delivery and distribution model.
	Ensure cost effective measures of buying facility materials and supply for the factory.
	Document according to our files all costs and stock inventory reports.
	Attend to any other tasks given to you by the PM.


Person Specification


	Must possess minimum of HND in Business Administration, Accounting and Finance.
	2 years of experience in a similar role is an added advantage.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Must be a Team Player and have Administrative Skills.


Salary and Benefits


	N110,000 Net Salary
	Transport &amp; Palliative Allowance
	Office phone + data (strictly for work and cannot be converted to personal phone)
	Performance Bonus
	End of year Bonus
	Pension
	Leave (Annual, Sick, Casual, Maternity, Paternity).


Note


	The Production Manager will supervise you.
	You must ensure that all invoices, inventory reports, Orders and Payments must be placed on the Group and obtain adequate approval from your supervisor.
	Candidates must reside within Ilupeju and its environs
",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-26",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Primofinesse consulting"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "184928"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Factory Admin Staff Job at PrimoFinesse Consulting




        
    

        
        PrimoFinesse - Our client, LoshesChocolate is a registered trademark for Firt Macaw Consult. They source and process locally grown coco beans into chocolates.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory Admin Staff

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Model: Physical (On-site)
Work Hours: Mon-Fri (8am -5pm) Sat (8am – 2pm)
Name of Company: LoshesChocolate

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	State daily on the company internal chats activities and work plans to be achieved daily.
	Ensure all activities are aligned with the policies and objectives of the organization. No decision or activity will be carried without a prior authorization on the group.
	Develop and implement admin budgets for facility supplies ensure work plan developed is aligned with Operations and set targets
	Ensure consistent and accurate data reporting in conformance with business processes – internal EXPENCE, AUDIT FILE, WHATSAPP.
	Attend to customer enquiries on WhatsApp and by phone-call.
	Take bi-monthly assessments/audits of departments and staff performance against the business goals and plans.
	Perform human resource activities including but not limited to; hiring, evaluating performance, discipline for staff, motivate through positive feedback.
	Having an in-depth knowledge of business products and value proposition.
	Developing growth strategies and business proposals to generate revenue. Attend to existing clients and source new clients to increase revenue.
	Be always polite and helpful to clients. Manage existing client relationships – B2B, B2B2C, B2C and develop strategies for client retention as well
	Manage and oversee the distribution and supply of products to clients using the approved delivery and distribution model.
	Ensure cost effective measures of buying facility materials and supply for the factory.
	Document according to our files all costs and stock inventory reports.
	Attend to any other tasks given to you by the PM.


Person Specification


	Must possess minimum of HND in Business Administration, Accounting and Finance.
	2 years of experience in a similar role is an added advantage.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Must be a Team Player and have Administrative Skills.


Salary and Benefits


	N110,000 Net Salary
	Transport & Palliative Allowance
	Office phone + data (strictly for work and cannot be converted to personal phone)
	Performance Bonus
	End of year Bonus
	Pension
	Leave (Annual, Sick, Casual, Maternity, Paternity).


Note


	The Production Manager will supervise you.
	You must ensure that all invoices, inventory reports, Orders and Payments must be placed on the Group and obtain adequate approval from your supervisor.
	Candidates must reside within Ilupeju and its environs
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "description": "U-Connect Human Resource Limited is a leading provider of HR Services: Founded in 2004, we are a Human resource consulting company with head office in Lekki peninsula, Lagos. We are a proud Nigerian operation offering local support and services in the area of Human resource solutions with service offerings that include world-class personnel outsourcing, e-recruitment, headhunting, training and development, quality management solutions, outplacements, verification, computer-based pre-assessment, and competency testing as well as Business process outsourcing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Fulfillment (CFC) Agent (Call Center Role)
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description


	We are recruiting smart, service-oriented individuals to join our team as Customer Fulfillment Center Agents in a full-time role.


Responsibilities


	Handle inbound and outbound calls with professionalism.
	Resolve customer inquiries and complaints efficiently.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and timely issue resolution.
	Support the fulfillment and service processes as required.


Requirements


	Must hold an HND or B.Sc in any discipline (no OND/NCE).
	0 - 1 year of experience in customer service or a similar role.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Eagerness to provide excellent service and contribute to team success.
	Must be 27 years old or younger.


Salary
N138,000 / Month plus attractive benefits.",

Customer Fulfillment (CFC) Agent (Call Center Role) Job at U-Connect Human Resource Limited




        
    

        
        U-Connect Human Resource Limited is a leading provider of HR Services: Founded in 2004, we are a Human resource consulting company with head office in Lekki peninsula, Lagos. We are a proud Nigerian operation offering local support and services in the area of Human resource solutions with service offerings that include world-class personnel outsourcing, e-recruitment, headhunting, training and development, quality management solutions, outplacements, verification, computer-based pre-assessment, and competency testing as well as Business process outsourcing.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Fulfillment (CFC) Agent (Call Center Role)
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description


	We are recruiting smart, service-oriented individuals to join our team as Customer Fulfillment Center Agents in a full-time role.


Responsibilities


	Handle inbound and outbound calls with professionalism.
	Resolve customer inquiries and complaints efficiently.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and timely issue resolution.
	Support the fulfillment and service processes as required.


Requirements


	Must hold an HND or B.Sc in any discipline (no OND/NCE).
	0 - 1 year of experience in customer service or a similar role.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Eagerness to provide excellent service and contribute to team success.
	Must be 27 years old or younger.


Salary
N138,000 / Month plus attractive benefits.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Territory Sales Executive (Offa)",
  "description": "Paga is a licensed financial services company and a leading payments company in Nigeria with a massive transformative purpose - to make it simple for one billion people to access and use money. It was founded on the simple belief that the ubiquity of mobile phones can be leveraged in building an ecosystem that enables people to digitally send and receive money and creating simple financial access for everyone.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Territory Sales Executive (Offa)

Job Location:&nbsp;Offa, Ilorin - Kwara
Work mode:&nbsp;Hybrid
Sector:&nbsp;Financial Institution
Reports To:&nbsp;Regional Manager,&nbsp; West Region

About the Role


	The Territory Sales Executive (TSE) oversees assigned areas to deliver all commercial targets in their territory.
	The TSE is responsible for assigned team&rsquo;s sales productivity and directs effort to have overall impact on company results.
	The TSE manages all aspects of running an efficient sales team, including supervising, coaching, disciplining, and motivating direct reports to deliver on sales targets.&nbsp;


Primary Responsibilities
Achievement of commercial targets set for the territory:


	A Territory Sales Executive has ownership for achieving the overall commercial targets set for all areas within their territory. These targets include targets for active agent count, transaction mix, transaction value, transaction volume, among others.


Coaching/Mentoring Agents, PSPs &amp; Aggregators in the assigned territory:


	Train and retrain PSPs &amp; Aggregators under their supervision to ensure that they train agents to expected standard.
	Mentor, coach and provide immediate correction to agents, PSPs, aggregators, and escalate issues to State Managers where applicable.
	Communicate important company updates to the PSPs &amp; Aggregators in their zone and ensuring that the information is understood.
	Assess the activities and performance of PSPs &amp; Aggregators under their supervision and report to the State Managers where applicable.


Representing Paga in the assigned territory:


	Verify agent outlet before account is created.
	Conduct agent knowledge assessment, within 4 weeks, after agent is trained.
	Develop and maintain a positive and professional relationship with all agency principals and outlet assistants across their territory.
	Report issues and communicate insights internally to ensure that relevant resources are deployed to strengthen the Paga business in their territory.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree&nbsp;from an&nbsp;accredited&nbsp;university&nbsp;or&nbsp;college&nbsp;
	Must be proficient with&nbsp;Microsoft Excel&nbsp;and other&nbsp;Microsoft Office applications
	Must be able to understand and report issues appropriately
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Provide outstanding customer service.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership skills
	Strong interpersonal/communication skills
	Takes initiative and ownership
	Must be self-drivean and excited about winning
	Detail oriented
	Flexible: willingness to test ideas quickly and take learnings
	Good interpersonal skills

Territory Sales Executive (Offa) Job at Paga Limited




        
    

        
        Paga is a licensed financial services company and a leading payments company in Nigeria with a massive transformative purpose - to make it simple for one billion people to access and use money. It was founded on the simple belief that the ubiquity of mobile phones can be leveraged in building an ecosystem that enables people to digitally send and receive money and creating simple financial access for everyone.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Territory Sales Executive (Offa)

Job Location: Offa, Ilorin - Kwara
Work mode: Hybrid
Sector: Financial Institution
Reports To: Regional Manager,  West Region

About the Role
     

            
    




	The Territory Sales Executive (TSE) oversees assigned areas to deliver all commercial targets in their territory.
	The TSE is responsible for assigned team’s sales productivity and directs effort to have overall impact on company results.
	The TSE manages all aspects of running an efficient sales team, including supervising, coaching, disciplining, and motivating direct reports to deliver on sales targets. 


Primary Responsibilities
Achievement of commercial targets set for the territory:


	A Territory Sales Executive has ownership for achieving the overall commercial targets set for all areas within their territory. These targets include targets for active agent count, transaction mix, transaction value, transaction volume, among others.


Coaching/Mentoring Agents, PSPs & Aggregators in the assigned territory:


	Train and retrain PSPs & Aggregators under their supervision to ensure that they train agents to expected standard.
	Mentor, coach and provide immediate correction to agents, PSPs, aggregators, and escalate issues to State Managers where applicable.
	Communicate important company updates to the PSPs & Aggregators in their zone and ensuring that the information is understood.
	Assess the activities and performance of PSPs & Aggregators under their supervision and report to the State Managers where applicable.


Representing Paga in the assigned territory:


	Verify agent outlet before account is created.
	Conduct agent knowledge assessment, within 4 weeks, after agent is trained.
	Develop and maintain a positive and professional relationship with all agency principals and outlet assistants across their territory.
	Report issues and communicate insights internally to ensure that relevant resources are deployed to strengthen the Paga business in their territory.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college 
	Must be proficient with Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office applications
	Must be able to understand and report issues appropriately
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Provide outstanding customer service.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership skills
	Strong interpersonal/communication skills
	Takes initiative and ownership
	Must be self-drivean and excited about winning
	Detail oriented
	Flexible: willingness to test ideas quickly and take learnings
	Good interpersonal skills
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Position: Bancassurance Executive&nbsp;(Insurance Sales)
Job Locations:&nbsp;Ijebu Ode, Ogun &amp; Ile-Ife, Osun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Bancassurance Executives act as the Company&rsquo;s representatives in identifying business opportunities (Sales of Life and General Insurance Products) within designated partner bank branches closest to their homes.


Key Responsibilities


	Establish, maintain, and grow relationships with Branch employees and customers.
	Solicit new clients and grow prospective/existing clientele.
	Handles activities that involve reporting, planning, and administration.
	Conducts market analysis activities, which include branch/client profiling and surveys on competitor products.
	Attends the District/Region&rsquo;s monthly/quarterly meetings.


Requirements
Experience/Qualification:


	First-degree or equivalent education
	Minimum of 2 years of post-NYSC work experience with at least 1 year of experience in Insurance Sales.


Skills:


	Team player
	Good oral and written communication skills
	Good interpersonal skills
	Excellent Grooming
	Adaptability, Flexibility, and Tenacity.


Benefits
N136,000 Monthly Net + Commission + Other Benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;recruitment@dunnandbraxton.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Bancassurance Executive (Insurance Sales) Job at Dunn And Braxton Limited




        
    

        
        Dunn And Braxton Limited - Our client, a Financial Firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bancassurance Executive (Insurance Sales)
Job Locations: Ijebu Ode, Ogun & Ile-Ife, Osun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Bancassurance Executives act as the Company’s representatives in identifying business opportunities (Sales of Life and General Insurance Products) within designated partner bank branches closest to their homes.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Establish, maintain, and grow relationships with Branch employees and customers.
	Solicit new clients and grow prospective/existing clientele.
	Handles activities that involve reporting, planning, and administration.
	Conducts market analysis activities, which include branch/client profiling and surveys on competitor products.
	Attends the District/Region’s monthly/quarterly meetings.


Requirements
Experience/Qualification:


	First-degree or equivalent education
	Minimum of 2 years of post-NYSC work experience with at least 1 year of experience in Insurance Sales.


Skills:


	Team player
	Good oral and written communication skills
	Good interpersonal skills
	Excellent Grooming
	Adaptability, Flexibility, and Tenacity.


Benefits
N136,000 Monthly Net + Commission + Other Benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: recruitment@dunnandbraxton.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "TheHRHive, a&nbsp;Recruitment Company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Finance &amp; Capital Strategy Advisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;

Overview


	We are seeking a finance professional to lead strategic capital initiatives and institutional relationship management.
	This role focuses on optimizing our capital structure and building sustainable funding partnerships for continued growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute comprehensive capital strategy including debt and equity initiatives&nbsp;
	Structure complex financial transactions and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
	Build and maintain strategic relationships with institutional partners and investors
	Support long-term financial planning and regulatory capital management
	Lead cross-functional projects related to balance sheet optimization.


Requirements


	8 - 12 years of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, or related fields
	Strong understanding of capital markets and structured finance products
	Proven ability to manage complex transactions and stakeholder relationships
	Experience in emerging markets and financial services preferred.


Salary Range
N500,000 - N700,000 net per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;thehrhive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Senior Finance & Capital Strategy Advisor Job at HR Hive




        
    

        
        TheHRHive, a Recruitment Company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Finance & Capital Strategy Advisor

Job Location: Lagos 

Overview


	We are seeking a finance professional to lead strategic capital initiatives and institutional relationship management.
	This role focuses on optimizing our capital structure and building sustainable funding partnerships for continued growth.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and execute comprehensive capital strategy including debt and equity initiatives 
	Structure complex financial transactions and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
	Build and maintain strategic relationships with institutional partners and investors
	Support long-term financial planning and regulatory capital management
	Lead cross-functional projects related to balance sheet optimization.


Requirements


	8 - 12 years of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, or related fields
	Strong understanding of capital markets and structured finance products
	Proven ability to manage complex transactions and stakeholder relationships
	Experience in emerging markets and financial services preferred.


Salary Range
N500,000 - N700,000 net per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: thehrhive@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
